snippet: Delays, missed business appointments, a broken guitar — there are places that will help you lodge a complaint and get some satisfaction from the airline.
abstract: Airline passengers have taken to broadcasting their annoyance over flight delays and other travel annoyances; Twitter and YouTube posts are a way to vent frustrations and catch the attention of offending carriers for customers seeking redress. Photo (M)a
lead_paragraph: IN his 12 years as a semi-frequent traveler, David Shashoua never got bumped off a flight twice in one day. But that's what happened on Dec. 30, 2011, when Mr. Shashoua arrived at the Ontario, Calif., airport at 6:45 a.m., in plenty of time for his 8:39 a.m. United flight to La Guardia. He made himself comfortable, only to be told that the flight was canceled because of ''unknown and unexplained corporate staffing problems,'' said Mr. Shashoua, a tax lawyer in Riverside, Calif.

headline.main: Seeking Redress When Air Travel Goes Awry
